title: Adding on-graph labels
text: Coloured labels placed directly plot better graph legends making final, polished version graph presentations, notes briefings three key reasons. Labels make much easier reader identify group colour corresponds , without rapid eye twitch graph legend back . Repeat every group present graph soon recipe eyestrain. Labels make efficient use available space graph removing need make room legend. Legends create unused white space around legend element force plot shorter narrower otherwise . Labels aesthetic legends.

title: Adding on-graph labels
text: simplest way add plot labels use plot_label() function esctheme. following code provides example. code set mock data create chart, two lines important plot_label() lines. plot_label() requires provide text label (label), x y positioning. information, see documentation (?plot_label). using function, make sure wording vector label names label argument exactly colour/fill aesthetic plotted, order label vector matches order colour/fill aesthetic ordering colours. One way ensure setting column data ordered factor, calling label names using levels(data$col_name).
code: ## basic example code  # create a dataset esc_colours <- esc_palette(4) specie <- c(rep("sorgho" , 4) , rep("poacee" , 4) , rep("banana" , 4) , rep("triticum" , 4)) condition <- rep(c("Normal" , "Stress" , "Nitrogen", "Other") , 4) value <- rep(c(-5 , 15, -31, 26), 4) data <- data.frame(specie,condition,value)   data <- data %>%    dplyr::arrange(specie, rev(value)) %>%    dplyr::group_by(specie) %>%    dplyr::mutate(label_y = cumsum(value)-0.5*value)  # Plot data with ESC style data %>%    ggplot(aes(fill=condition, y=value, x=specie)) +    geom_bar(position="stack", stat="identity", show.legend = FALSE) +   scale_fill_manual(values = esc_palette(4)) +   scale_x_discrete(expand = expansion(add = c(0.5,1))) +   plot_label(     label = c("Nitrogen", "Normal", "Other", "Stress"),     x = c(rep(4.5, 4)),     y = c(-20, -5, 25, 10),     colour = esc_palette(4),     size = 4   ) +   labs(title = "This is a title",        subtitle = "Plot labels using plot_label()") +   esc_theme(rm_y_leg = TRUE)

code: data <- data.frame(   x = rep(c(1, 2), 2),   y = rep(c(1, 2), 2),   f_var = factor(c(1, 1, 2, 2)),   group = factor(c(1, 2, 1, 2)) )  data %>%    ggplot(aes(x, y, colour = group)) +    geom_point(size = 5, show.legend = FALSE) +   facet_wrap(~f_var) +   scale_colour_manual(values = esc_palette(2)) +   scale_y_continuous(limits = c(0,3), expand = expansion(mult = 0)) +   plot_label(     label = c("Label 1", "Label 2"),     x = c(1, 1.85),     y = c(1.3, 2.3),     colour = esc_palette(2),     facet_name = "f_var",     facet_value = "1"   ) +   labs(title = "This is a title",        subtitle = "Plot labels using plot_label()") +   esc_theme(rm_y_leg = TRUE) data %>%    ggplot(aes(x, y, colour = group)) +    geom_point(size = 5, show.legend = FALSE) +   facet_wrap(~f_var) +   scale_colour_manual(values = esc_palette(2)) +   scale_y_continuous(limits = c(0,3), expand = expansion(mult = 0)) +   plot_label(     label = c("Label 1", "Label 2"),     x = c(1, 1.85),     y = c(1.3, 2.3),     colour = esc_palette(2),     facet_name = "f_var",     facet_value = c("1", "2")   ) +   labs(title = "This is a title",        subtitle = "Plot labels using plot_label()") +   esc_theme(rm_y_leg = TRUE)

title: Create ggplot2 charts in the Essential Services Commission of Victoria style
text: basic example shows use theme:
code: library(esctheme) r_setup() ## basic example code  # create a dataset esc_colours <- esc_palette() specie <- c(rep("sorgho" , 4) , rep("poacee" , 4) , rep("banana" , 4) , rep("triticum" , 4)) condition <- rep(c("Normal" , "Stress" , "Nitrogen", "Other") , 4) value <- rnorm(16 , -5 , 15) data <- data.frame(specie,condition,value)   data <- data %>%    dplyr::arrange(specie, rev(value)) %>%    dplyr::group_by(specie) %>%    dplyr::mutate(label_y = cumsum(value)-0.5*value)  # Plot data with ESC style data %>%    ggplot(aes(fill=condition, y=value, x=specie)) +    geom_bar(position="stack", stat="identity") +   scale_fill_manual(values = esc_colours) +   facet_wrap(~condition) +   labs(title = "This is a title",        subtitle = "This is a subtitle") +   esc_theme(rm_y_leg = TRUE)

code: plot_label(   label,   x,   y,   colour = NA,   size = 3.5,   hjust = 0,   geom = c("text", "label"),   angle = 0,   facet_name = NULL,   facet_value = NULL )

title: Add on-graph labels to graphs — plot_label
text: label String vector. Label text displayed. x Numeric string vector. X-axis positions label text. y Numeric string vector. Y-axis positions label text. colour (optional) Vector colour names strings. Default uses e61 palette. size (optional) Integer. Size text, default size appropriate cases. hjust (optional) numeric value 0-1. Adjusts alignment text. 0 left-aligns (default), 0.5 centre-aligns 1 right-aligns. geom (optional) String. Either "text" (default) "label". "label" adds white box around text useful sometimes. angle (optional) Numeric. Rotate labels. Defaults 0 normal left--right text. facet_name, facet_value (optional) String. Specify name facetting variable facet_name panel show labels using facet_value. Defaults NULL shows labels facets. must specify facet_name facet_value leave NULL.
